metadata.title: CVE-2024-26954 on Ubuntu 22.04 FIPS Compliant (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ksmbd:fix slab-out-of-bounds in smb_strndup_from_utf16() If ->NameOffset ofsmb2_create_req is smaller than Buffer offset of smb2_create_req,slab-out-of-bounds read can happen from smb2_open. This patch set theminimum value of the name offset to the buffer offset to validate namelength of smb2_create_req().

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
linux-hwe-6.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.5').
linux-hwe-6.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.8, was needed').
